row.question: Two trains are running with speed 30 km/hr. and 58km/hr. in the same direction. A man in the slower train passes the faster train in 18 seconds. The length (in metres) of the faster trains is:
row.rationale:
The relative speed = 58 - 30 = 28 Km/hr. = 140/18 m/s.
Therefore in 18 secs the faster train travels = (140/18) * 18 = 140
Answer D
